## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hey! I'm here to help with any questions you might have about Verus. What's on your mind today?

**User:**
Yeah, I've been following the recent updates and I'm curious about what's new. What's an important update included in a recent version of Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
This release includes an important update of the OpenSSL library, which addresses a buffer overflow vulnerability. It's essential to stay up-to-date with the latest security patches, and we're committed to keeping Verus secure.

**User:**
That's good to know. I've also been testing on TestNet. What's the status of cross-chain notarization on TestNet after the latest release?

**AI Assistant:**
We're happy to report that cross-chain notarization has been re-enabled on TestNet with this release, after having been disabled due to issues with the auto-notarization protocol. We're always working to improve the stability and functionality of our features.

**User:**
I remember there were some issues with auto-notarization. What were they, exactly?

**AI Assistant:**
We encountered two issues: a notarization bug that caused notarizations to fork, and a problem with the protocol taking too long and generating too large proofs. These issues have been addressed and will be optimized in the next few days. We're committed to delivering a robust and efficient protocol.

**User:**
Lastly, I'm interested in merge mining PBaaS chains with Verus or the Ethereum bridge to Goerli. What do I need to do going forward?

**AI Assistant:**
To merge mine PBaaS chains with Verus or the Ethereum bridge to Goerli going forward, you will need to update to v0.9.9-2, which is also the recommended version for mainnet. Make sure to update to the latest version to take advantage of the latest features and security updates.
What is an important update included in a recent version of Verus?
This release includes an important update of the OpenSSL library, which addresses a buffer overflow vulnerability.

This release also includes an important update of the OpenSSL library, which Verus uses for encrypted node connections and addresses a buffer overflow vulnerability in that library.#### What’s New for TestNet This release re-enables cross-chain notarization, and represents the completion of a great deal of learning from the first roll out of auto notarization. Basically, we encountered two issues:1) There was a notarization bug in a significantly updated approach that caused notarizations to fork, effectively simulating a worst case, unmitigated attack on the notarization system. While that did not cause the system to fail per se, it resulted in the generation of many perceived, although not real, notarization forks on the network.2) Due to our effort to err on the side of more evidence than we believed was sufficient with auto notarization, then optimize to reduce the proofs required, the protocol was simply taking too long and generating too large proofs to be reasonable, required, or what we need on mainnet in any real scenario.As a result, we will take a few days to change some parameters in the auto notarization protocol that will both reduce the total and maximum amount of proof required, as well as provide a sufficient level of cryptographic proof, similar in strength to the current proof model with more efficient and selective proof choices. We don’t expect this important step to take long, and until then, we will leave testnet on the pre-PBaaS to mainnet preparatory state.The good news is that since we have the new Verus Notification Oracle technology, we can enable everyone running on the current testnet to remain connected as all cross-chain transactions to and from PBaaS chains will resume flowing. We are still seeing an error in BridgeKeeper, but since this release includes a mainnet security update and addresses all other known issues on testnet, we’ll release this immediately and update Bridgekeeper as soon as possible. In order to merge mine PBaaS chains with Verus or the Ethereum bridge to Goerli going forward, you will need to update to v0.9.9-2, which everyone should run for mainnet anyhow.Once you update, please feel free to resume merge mining all PBaaS chains and Verus. You will need to wait for the BridgeKeeper update to be able to merge mine and stake with Ethereum’s Goerli.

Cross-chain notarization has been re-enabled on TestNet with this release, after having been disabled due to issues with the auto-notarization protocol.
